revised_title: Discovery and Observations of Two New Comets in the Marine Observatory at Paris
tldr: M. Messier and M. Maty report the discovery and observations of two new comets at the Marine Observatory in Paris. They describe their methods, including the use of telescopes and micrometers, and provide tables of their observations and positions of the stars they compared the comets with. The comets passed their perihelion on February 17 and April 8, 1766.
